meanings.sent1: The gentle murmur of the stream was soothing.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the murmur of voices in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The murmur of the wind through the trees sounded like a lullaby.
meanings.sent4: The murmur of the crowd was like a soft blanket covering the stadium.
meanings.sent5: The murmur of the waterfall created a peaceful atmosphere.

meanings.sent1: The murmur of the distant traffic filled the air.
meanings.sent2: She could hear the murmur of the leaves rustling in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The murmur of the rain on the roof was like a gentle drumbeat.
meanings.sent4: The murmur of the waves crashing on the shore was a calming melody.
meanings.sent5: The murmur of the bees buzzing around the flowers was a sign of spring.

meanings.definition: To speak in a low, soft voice
meanings.sent1: She would murmur her secrets to her best friend.
meanings.sent2: He would murmur his love poems under his breath.
meanings.sent3: The students would murmur the answers to each other during the test.
meanings.sent4: The lovers would murmur sweet nothings to each other in the moonlight.
meanings.sent5: The old man would murmur stories of the past to anyone who would listen.

meanings.definition: To make a low, continuous sound
meanings.sent1: The wind would murmur through the cracks in the window.
meanings.sent2: The leaves would murmur in the breeze on a calm day.
meanings.sent3: The engine would murmur softly as the car idled.
meanings.sent4: The river would murmur as it flowed gently downstream.
meanings.sent5: The bees would murmur as they worked together in the hive.
